document_data.caption: A map showing the location of the Red Gauntlet on the Way of the Dragon in the Southern Ward.
document_data.name: The Red Gauntlet
document_data.location: [[Way of the Dragon (Waterdeep)|Way of the Dragon]], [[Waterdeep/Southern Ward|Southern Ward]], [[Waterdeep]]
document_data.mainbody: The ''' Red Gauntlet''' was a tavern located in the city of [[Waterdeep]] during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The tavern stood on the north side of the southern stretch of the [[Way of the Dragon (Waterdeep)|Way of the Dragon]] in the [[Tween Run]] of Waterdeep's [[Waterdeep/Southern Ward|Southern Ward]].{{Cite interactive atlas|Waterdeep}}
document_data.Description: The tavern stood two stories tall. The interior was poorly lit and shabby.
document_data.Services: Food served here consisted mostly of dried fish, waybread, and rabbit-and-fowl stew. Drink consisted of a house [[wine]]. The fares were cheap in the Red Gauntlet with a plate of food running just 3 [[cp]] and a tankard 2 cp.
document_data.Activities: The Red Gauntlet allowed patrons to drink themselves to sleep and stay, provided they did not snore too loudly. Anyone becoming rowdy or threatening was slipped a sleep syrup in their drink to placate them.
document_data.Inhabitants: The Red Gauntlet was owned by a retired [[thief]] named [[Daunt Buirune]].
